titleStmt.title: The day dawned both to Jews and Gentiles, and clear discoveries of light and righteousness; the bright and moning star appearing Jacob wrestled with the angel until the break of the day, and would not let him go until he blessed him.
titleStmt.author: D. W. (Dorothy White)

titleStmt.title: The day dawned both to Jews and Gentiles, and clear discoveries of light and righteousness; the bright and moning star appearing Jacob wrestled with the angel until the break of the day, and would not let him go until he blessed him.
titleStmt.author: D. W. (Dorothy White)

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: Dorothy Wight [i.e. White].
With errata at foot of p. 16.
Text and register are continuous despite pagination.
Reproduction of the original in the Swarthmore College Library, Pennsylvania.
